children.title: New slide
children.content:
Community engagement and dissemination

WP10 progress report

(18. April 2017)

Michael Martin (InfAI)

children.title: New slide
children.content:
The road so far*

  • EU-Website - https://slidewiki.eu
    • 8* blog posts (3**)
    • 0* publications (1**)
    • 7* (6 trial reports) deliverables published (5**)
    • Updated Design and added information
  • Twitter Channel - https://twitter.com/slidewiki
    • 21* Tweets (25**)
    • 40* Followers (31**)
  • 1 (private) Hackathon (Amsterdam) (2**)
  • Facebook page
    • shares EU blog posts
  • Introduced metrics
  • ~35 participants from workshops

* - since Genoa, November 2016

** - between Milton Keynes and Genoa

Next Deliverable: M18 - Progress Report

children.title: New slide
children.content:
Website improvements - www.slidewiki.eu

  • New Design
    • + new pictures
    • + better quality pictures
  • Revised “Results” pages
    • Publications
    • Deliverables
  • Added “Dev News” Section
    • Open-Source
    • Project Management
    • Developer Blog feed
  • Pace Increase for blog posts
    • ~2 posts a month

Please write posts directly in Wordpress!

content.html: Please write posts directly in Wordpress!

children.content:
First Public Hackathon & Conference Participation

Public Hackathon

  • No third party developers
  • Some students from Fraunhofer

Conference Participation

  • SlideWiki Workshops
    • OU at Open Education Global, Cape Town (30 participants)
    • OU & Soton at OER, London (5 participants)

children.title: New slide
children.content:
Community Engagement (Deliverable in the end of June)

We need to start to build up a community!

Proposal as a first step: Set up a tool website, that covers

  • Introduction text to the tool
  • Releases (monthly + changelog)
  • Who’s using SlideWiki (famous institutes and companies)
  • How to set it up
  • (Developer) Documentation (part of WP 1-5)
  • → benefits for WP10 and is a prerequisite for WP11

Breakout Session?
